meanings.definition: To strike or beat with a loud, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: He was thwacking the drum with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was thwacking the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The chef was thwacking the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm was thwacking the windows with raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was thwacking the board to get the students' attention.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a thwacking punch to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: The thwacking of the hammer against the wall echoed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The thwacking of the ball against the wall startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The thwacking of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The thwacking of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
